doc.field: Much of box holds print matter re: WTC/9/11, including: Special editions of magazines Firecall, Firefighters Quarterly, WNYF, LIFE, Fire Engineering, Firehouse. Reports and books: WTC Crisis Support Project Final Report; FDNY Memorial Day Oct 12, 2002 booklets; FDNY book "Helping America Cope"; print from web of US Fire Admin's "WTC Bombing (1993): Report & Analysis"; Powerpoint? of "Flight Recorder Recovery" with images and summary; Powerpoint by OSHA on WTC site safety (2002); Poynter Institute collection of newspaper front pages; "In the Line of Duty" book; "Ground Zero: Behind the Scenes, 10-year anniversary edition" book; "Trauma & Transformation at Ground Zero" book. Also various web print-outs etc of short WTC-related articles. A folder re: dispute over William Langewiesche's book "American Ground" in which he charges FDNY with looting at Ground Zero. A copy of book "100 Years on Duane Street (Ladder 1, Engine 7, Battalion 1)" history refers to WTC. Rest of box includes print matter on general firefighting, though these are probably there from a WTC context: wire rope user manual, safety equipment catalogs, crane & rigging training manual and related, respirator inspection, working safely with silica, various Powerpoint presentations on safety including fall protection. "A Firefighter's Night Before Christmas" small book.
